qas.question: When did al-Qaeda attack the US embassy in Kenya?
How many people were killed when al-Qaeda attacked US embassies in 1998?
How many Americans were killed when al-Qaeda attacked US embassies in 1998?
What operation did Bill Clinton start to retaliate for the 1998 embassy attacks?
How much of Sudan's medicines were produced by a pharmaceutical plant Clinton's operation bombed?

plausible_answers.text: al-Qaeda struck the U.S. embassies in Kenya and Tanzania

qas.question: Where was the pharmaceutical plant said to produce 12% of Sudan's pharmaceutical needs?

plausible_answers.text: al-Qaeda struck the U.S. embassies in Kenya and Tanzania

qas.question: What happened to kill 224 people, including 50 Americans?
How many people did Operation Infinite Reach kill?
When was Operation Infinite Reach launched?
What percentage of Afghanistan's pharmaceutical needs were produced by the plant?
What operation killed several members of the Taliban?
Which US embassies were bombed in Operation Infinite Reach?

context: On <a0_0><b10_0>7 August 1998<b10_0/><a0_0/>, <b5_0><b8_0>al-Qaeda struck the U.S. embassies in <b13_0>Kenya and Tanzania<b13_0/><b8_0/><b5_0/>, killing <a1_0><b9_0>224<b9_0/><a1_0/> people, including <a2_0>12<a2_0/> Americans. In retaliation, <b6_0>U.S. President Bill Clinton<b6_0/> launched <a3_0><b12_0>Operation Infinite Reach<b12_0/><a3_0/>, a bombing campaign in Sudan and Afghanistan against targets the U.S. asserted were associated with WIFJAJC, although others have questioned whether a pharmaceutical plant in <b7_0>Sudan<b7_0/> was used as a chemical warfare plant. The plant produced much of the region's antimalarial drugs and <a4_0>around <b11_0>50%<b11_0/><a4_0/> of Sudan's pharmaceutical needs. The strikes failed to kill any leaders of WIFJAJC or the Taliban.
